artist: Engraver: A.B. Duhamel; Author: Jean-Antoine Lebrun-Tossa; Publisher: François Buisson
catalogue_raissonne:
Colas 1936
Cabinet des Modes
Le Brun
creditline:
The Minnich Collection
The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund, 1966
description: Fashion periodical with a trifold hand-colored engraving of a clock face on the left surrounded by vines, grapes, and leaves with the long hand set at 10:00 and the short hand at 12:00 suspended over a pedestal which includes two cherubs holding baskets of vines and other foliage over their heads at either end of the pedestal; in the center a woman in a pink/purple gown with green stripes, a white cape with brown fur trim, a brown muff with an orange bow, and a brown hat with pink ribbon and plumes; on the right a woman in a light pink gown with a purple overgown and a black belt, a gray muff with a green bow, and a hat with red detailing
portfolio: From Magasin des Modes nouvelles, françaises et anglaises, Paris, 1786-89
title: Magasin des Modes Nouvelles, Quatrième Année, Sixième Cahier, 21 Janvier 1789
